snippet: Major temperature swings are an oddity in Los Angeles. But there are potholes aplenty. On some major streets, every downpour seems to bring another jarring rut.
abstract: Complaints about potholes are common among residents of Los Angeles County, California, which a 2009 study by American Assn of State Highway and Transportation Officials found to have the worst road quality of any metro area in the nation; LA Mayor Antonio R Villaraigosa wants to spend $750 million to fix holes in city streets, but the City Council thinks that is too expensive.
lead_paragraph: Major temperature swings are an oddity in Los Angeles. But there are potholes aplenty. On some major streets, every downpour seems to bring another jarring rut.

headline.seo: In Los Angeles, Driving Is a Jarring Experience
headline.main: The Downs and Ups of Driving in Los Angeles
headline.print_headline: The Downs and Ups of Los Angeles
